intro: Peucedanum hyrcanicum, commonly known as the Hyrcanian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Peucedanum hyrcanicum is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
